text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with spicy shrimp and jalapeno
nachos
that's right Cinco DeMayo is coming up I
believe it falls on May 5th this year
and what better way to Fiesta than with
this beautiful plate of alternative
nachos I mean I love the traditional
super greasy heavy fake meat fake cheese
sauce style but I think this would make
a beautiful and very delicious change of
pace to the traditional version so let
me show you how to do these we're going
to start by cooking a little shrimp and
yes that's always redundant so I have
one pound a gulf shrimp that we're
thawed and drained thoroughly I'm going
to go ahead and drizzle in a little bit
of oil and then we're going to season
these up with a pinch of cayenne some
Chipotle a little touch of black pepper
and a big pinch of salt and we're going
to take a spatula we're going to mix
that up thoroughly so glad I were sure
today so what we're going to do is we're
going to put a nonstick pan on high heat
and once it's hot we're going to go
ahead and throw in our shrimp and we
don't need any additional fat because we
coated those in a little bit of oil so
just dump those in and this is going to
be a very fast and in elegant operation
so as soon as you dump them in try to
get them in a single layer and as soon
as that happens you can go ahead and
start turning them although they're so
small and cooks so quickly you may not
have time to turn them all so you can
always give the pan a few shakes just
kind of toss them around like that and
then just turn the ones that haven't
turned or these are literally only going
like a minute per side we just want them
barely cook through and as soon as yours
or barely cook through go ahead and dump
those on a plate and just let them cool
down while we prep our chips so our
shrimp are cooked and cooling and we're
going to go over to a sheet pan that
I've lined with a little bit of lightly
oiled foil I'm going to go ahead lay
down my tortilla chips I'm using the
nice big ones I believe they call those
restaurant style for some reason is if
ice home cooks couldn't handle large
chips it's a little insulting but anyway
we're going to use the large restaurant
style chips
of course I've hand-picked the best ones
and once I've laid those out we're going
to go ahead and place one now cool
enough to handle shrimp in the center of
each chip okay and then once those chips
are shrimp
we're going to go ahead and put on one
thin slice of jalapeno and as you can
see I knock the seeds out I don't want
the seeds in there and you can see I
slice those nice and thin how Pena is
not a super spicy pepper anyway but even
so you don't want a really thick piece
and once the pepper is placed over
we're going to go ahead and cheese these
and the method I'm going to use here is
to put one big pinch on the top of each
one now if you want you can push all the
chips together put more on the pan and
then just sprinkle the cheese over
everything but the problem is when the
cheese melts instead of having
individual nachos you have one giant
nacho that you have to kind of pull
apart so even though this method takes
an extra minute I like to do them
individually and as far as the type of
cheese I'm going to use a pepper jack
it's a nice creamy mellow melty cheese
but of course you can use anything you
want you are the boss of your cheese
choices and then once they're all
covered with cheese we're going to go
ahead and melt the cheese over the top
now you can do this a couple ways you
can just put them in a hot oven like 400
degrees for about five minutes until the
cheese is nicely melted but I'm actually
gonna use the broiler which is much much
faster you're going to get a little more
caramelization the only danger is you
got to really watch them close they can
burn quickly in fact why am I still
holding this camera those are done whoo
okay I got them out just in time you can
see how gorgeous those are and they're
not even dressed yet so this point
depending on how many margaritas and or
cervesas you've had you may just start
eating them off the tray like this which
is tempting and delicious I ate one but
try not to eat them off the tray because
what we're going to do is put these on a
plate and make them mucho mas awesome
and the first step to that is a little
bit of avocado crema that's just half
avocado and half sour cream blended I
drizzled that over of course you could
just use diced avocado and sour cream
same difference and then I'm going to
finish this off with just some freshly
sliced cherry tomatoes and a whole bunch
of freshly chopped cilantro and those
spicy shrimp and jalapeno nachos are
done so simple so beautiful and
incredibly tasty the sweet juicy shrimp
with that spicy pepper the melty cheese
the crunchy chip and our lovely colorful
and tasty toppings these are just so
good and addictive I could have eaten 20
of these and I could have I mean a 20 of
these oh and then one last tip if you
happen to score the last nacho on the
tray or plate don't eat it right away
walk around the room pointing to it
saying this is mine
nachos all right trust me it'll be
hilarious and not at all annoying okay
so I really do hope you give these a try
head over to food wishes calm for all
the ingredient amounts and more info as
usual
and as always enjoy
